title: "Fiddle didn't need a jungle item"
body:
You obviously, (and riot of course) never played fiddle.

Right now, fiddle is next to postnerf2010-evelynn lvl. Literally can't be played, he already had several problems: 
-no jungle item
-too much depending on zhonya, if he didn't have it he would die 0.5 sec after ultying
-way too much mana cost, WHO ON EARTH has 120 mana cost on 2 spells except veigar who has a {{item:3028}}  passive?
-too much cc depending, his main spell that allows him to do damage and surviving requier his target to stand still for 5 seconds right in front of him since the range nerf(?????). and his fear only lasts 2.25 seconds (not counting tenacity and QSS). What can he do if he isn't draining? ultying but since 2014 the vision has been improved it's really easy to see fiddle comming and just back.
Throwing crows? nerfed, the spell has been nerfed in every fiddle patch since 2012.
reducing mr? also nerfed.

NOW: if you read this and watched the changes to items since 2014 you pretty much understood why he is unplayable.

**He can't jungle**, no no, i'm not saying that he is going to die. But what will happen if fiddle can't buy a jungle item? he won't be able to clear the jungle quickly, and that's going to have massive concequences:
-he can't jungle quickly to gank and bring presence
-he is going to use so much mana because his damage is severally reduced to monsters without a jungle item
-he can't have a gold efficient jungle item like every junglers

{{item:3157}}  nerf pretty much burrowed him, he can't have it quickly, he is going to die in every fight and be useless before at least 20 min  in the game.

i hope someone will do something for him.

The site just gives the numbers dude. It could be that Swain isn't picked often and the people who have ~50 games haven't played him in a long time, or they just happen to have losestreaks, we can't know for sure why this happens but it's not champion.gg's fault. Also keep in mind that champion.gg uses Riot's API, meaning if anything it's Riot's own fault for the numbers being wonky (not that it's anyone's fault).

Besides, weird stuff like that doesn't really invalidate the other numbers, especially not average winrates. It's not like they just make up the average winrate. Average winrate is just that, a ratio of wins/losses across the entire sample. People of all number of games and ranks above Gold are taken into account, making average winrate a pretty telling number when it comes to a champion's viability. Fiddlesticks being at 50% puts him just above the median for jungle and means at least 50% of the games he's in are wins. Still only pretty average, but more than viable. Fiddles could definitely be worse off.

isn't 50% win rate also ideal for a champion? if they win 50% of their games wouldn't they be considered balanced? or would balanced be 55%? (that's Vel'koz's win percentage, and people often refer to him as most balanced champ in the game due to him not being changed since release)

i'm honestly curious. i would honestly think a champion winning 50% of their games would make them balanced but i could be incorrect.

> [{quoted}](name=Broken Fangz,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=lNJx15K1,comment-id=0002000000000000,timestamp=2015-11-18T20:34:45.330+0000)

> 
> Edit: also, according to champion.gg Swain's winrate has been going up this patch, not down as the OP was trying to say in his reply to you. :/

Riot said their general idea is 53% max when played by people who main the champion/are experienced with them. This is why sometimes even when a champion is at a 50% average they'll still be OP because in some cases it means they are winning 60% of the time with experienced players. This is why Azir was nerfed despite his low average win rate, since his win rate was 58% with good players.

While I don't think avg. winrate alone is enough to determine a champion's balance, it's definitely a good place to start. Of course, a flat 50% strictly speaking would mean a champion is balanced, but you can go higher than that and still have a well balanced champion. _**To me**_, between 45% and 55%, avg. winrate is more a measure of how well off the champion is doing at a given moment, and anything higher or lower than that can mean the champion is under or overtuned. I think it's also important to look at how a champion's winrate changes with player experience. You can have a champion with a lowish, say, 48% winrate, but then have it spike up to 50% or even higher on a player with some games under their belt. Because avg. winrate takes all games on a particular champion into account, inexperienced players can bring the average down. It all depends on circumstances and other such factors.

To put it shortly, 49/50%-55% is a pretty ideal range, in my opinion.

The Swain anomaly OP pointed out was in reference to Swain's winrate by player experience, not patch. If you look at different champions on champion.gg, you'll find some (usually older, less played, or harder) champions have a weird thing where their winrate by player experience will dip as games played goes up, which contradicts common sense (more games = more experience = more skill). It's a weird occurrence that I can only imagine is explainable by how little these champions are usually played. When taking averages, low sample size means even a small amount of extreme numbers can skew the average one way or the other. In the case of a hard champion, a person's winrate for the first few games will likely be lower as they learn the champion, going back up as they get better. This is likely what we're seeing with Swain.

Keep in mind this is all conjecture, I'm no expert on any of this.

I feared jungle Fiddles back in season 4 and 5. I actually miss playing against him because he truly adds an element of terror to games and forces you to get good at vision in the wierdest places or he'll literally melt your entire team. It was completely different playing against Fiddlesticks than any other jungler. Riot making him unplayable means that it's alot harder to get high quality games against him.

The problem with Fiddle doing that now, though, is that so many other junglers can bring the "There may be sudden death" feeling and get going a lot faster. Sure, Fiddlesticks is probably one of the easiest characters to play compared to those and is one of the few junglers who'll always have full health after a clear but it takes him so long to get his ult and be more useful for ganking. Shaco ganks every lane a million times before you're level 4, Rengar just instantly deletes you with little warning, Amumu can suddenly come out of nowhere and whittle your health down, Jax can pop in from over a wall and just bash you to death... Hell, even Rammus and Hecarim can bring that sort of terror better than Fid. Fiddle is pretty ult-reliant to do much beyond harass a lane and even then... It's on a high-cooldown so he can't apply pressure and its best use is for ambushing onto a grouped team, and if you're grouped against Fiddlesticks you're not really thinking ahead.

Fiddle can't autoattack while draining, and Drain lasts 5 seconds.
Drain costs 80->120 mana (levels 1->9)

Runeglaive gives 8% of your missing mana; assuming that all the mana Fiddle has is the base one (else he's already built another mana item), that's 32->108 (levels 1->18) at most, assuming he's out of mana when he uses this bonus.

He's way better off skipping the jungle items... or at least he was, when all he lost doing this was a little bonus gold on camp kills and the Smite upgrade.

Now that the camps give less XP and the jungle items give bonus XP, Fiddle being an ulti reliant mage is forced to start with a jungle item that he's never going to upgrade and that doesn't give stats he'll actually use, since his mana costs are way too high for that passive regen to be actually useful.

>Also the new jungle pot helps out with sustain a lot.  Their are options, maybe you should use them

I haven't played him since 5.22, but Fiddlesticks might actually be slightly better compared to some other junglers.

In particular, Hunter's Talisman gives him a legitimate starting option that helps his early clear speeds in a way that the old Hunter's Machete didn't, got new mana regeneration options in the jungle such as Hunter's Potion and being able to run a Talisman + Faerie Charm start without dying to jungle camps, and overall his sustain just matters so much more because the jungle is so much harder for quite a few champions.

And does it really matter that Fiddlesticks doesn't have a jungle item now? Ever since Runeglaive came out the ideal strategy for him was to build your smite upgrade, then start building your core items, and now that all the jungle enchants are extremely cost-inefficient it literally doesn't matter that Fiddlesticks doesn't want the jungle items because the ideal strategy is to just not buy the jungle items at all.

Obviously Fiddlesticks did take a massive hit with the nerf to Zhonya's and he does have some big mana issues, but other than that he might be a bit better than how he was in Season 5.

Fiddle has basically no natural tankyness, which makes it really difficult. You might wonder why I factor in movespeed in the below comparison, but it's fairly important for keeping up with people, dodging stuff and kiting (insofar as fiddle can kite)
Health 	524 – 1884
Armor 	20.9 – 80.4
Magic res. 	30.0
Mov. speed 	335 
(drain)
Compared to other champions usually considered squishy:

Yasuo:
Health 	518 – 1912
Armor 	24.7 – 82.5
Magic res. 	30.0
Mov. speed 	345 
(Shield100 – 510, not to mention windwall/dashes. Yes, I am aware he's melee.)

Karthus
Health   516 – 1791
Armor    20.9 – 80.4
Magic res. 	30.0
Mov. speed 	335 
(passive means he doesn't have to be _as_ tanky)
He's only slightly tankier than Karthus (8-93 hp), and not nearly as tanky as yasuo (6 more base hp at lvl 1, but less hp/level and no shield. Less mobile and can't protect himself from cc. Though fidd gets a + for being mid-ranged)
Even if you build him as an ap bruiser, he'll still die easily. But more importantly you'll do less damage per second (more time for people to get out of your range because you're slow), you _still_ get absolutely destroyed by any random cc and your cooldowns are too long to use more then once, maybe twice with cdr, if you're not being ignored. Altough it could probably work if you have a solid cc team, I used to like playing him with an Orianna, Morgana, Malphite or Galio mid, Malphite or another aoe cc tank top and preferably thresh or leona bot*

*The numbers are current, but the experience I'm talking from is from season 3+4, and only minor experience in season 5 before magus removal.

RIP Fiddlesticks (and Cassiopeia), who led me to place in Gold III one season.
